website_summaries.verdict: A unique option for cycling with a large amount of equipment and tools to carry.
pros: The slew of small pockets and internal storage dividers offer great organizational possibilities for a lot of objects
Hides a small bladder pouch for extra water or another beverage
cons: The size runs smaller than advertised without adjustments of the straps

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Very sturdy and just the right amount of pockets/organizers. There is a space for a water bag, I put a 3 liter bag in and there is even a slot through the sleeve for the tube and straps to hold the bag (see photo), the tube goes through the right side. Light weight as well. UPDATE: I’ve now had this for a couple years and put many miles on it, I use it all the time for day hikes and cycling. Still looks new, no issues at all. I want to add that I’m impressed with the odor resistance. I get pretty bad but this doesn’t catch it.
customer_reviews.author: drichardson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap rain protector. Product seems like decent quality at original purchase.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE***** I am updating my review as it seems I write reviews too early. It was pouring rain and I put the rain cover this thing came with on, it ripped while I was putting it on, that was one of the huge advantages of this backpack!!!! Also seems as if the stitches are already wearing out around the whole backpack. Seems like quality. Not so much anymore :/***** This backpack is great! It holds a good amount of product, comes with a rain protector, backpack net, chest/stomach straps various pouches. I fit everything I need in here and more! I’ve hooked up multiple things to the straps on the bottom as well and they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rolla

customer_reviews.title: A lot of options and decently made
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pleased with the purchase. I use it on long walks instead of using my pockets and hands. I like that it has 2 mesh pockets on the inside to hold anything from bouncing around, and a few other pockets to hold everything needed for walks with a dog. It feels pretty sturdy, but is light. I'm a larger shoulder man and have no issues strapping it to me. It doesn't have a lot of excess strap around my chest or stomach, but still fits comfortably. The only complaints I have is that some of the reflective printed material is rubbing off and the back padding isn't real thick so it doesn't allow a lot of air flow.
customer_reviews.author: cfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of backpacks. If you're looking for a lightweight backpack just to put your essentials in, like a lap top or iPad, your headphones, and all your chargers, this is it. What i like about it is that it holds shape very well and doesn't collapse on you. There's a stiff board that runs along its length which does this. It's a solid build, had got a rain proof cover and sits really comfortably on your shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Jarraw

customer_reviews.title: this pack is comfortable. At such a low price point
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack to use on day-long rides on gravel paths. As a guide for the rides, I carry a first aid kit, a bike repair kit, and extra water bottles for the guests. Even loaded up, this pack is comfortable. At such a low price point, I don't expect that this pack will last for ten years, but it is holding up well so far this season. The pull-out mesh pocket that holds a helmet is very convenient for the shuttle ride.
customer_reviews.author: busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lightweight Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack! I use it for tiny packing. I use eagle creek compression cubes to pack my clothes. It fits perfectly in my backpack. I use the helmet holder to strap my running shoes to the outside. It’s very comfortable, lightweight, and perfect for tiny packing.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack at good price. I recommend if you want something small.
customer_reviews.text: Motorcycle use. Waterproof cover kinda sucks but it does help keep water out a little. I added some parachord to the clips to be able to carry a motorcycle helmet in the carrier and that does work but it’s clearly meant for a bicycle helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great pack
customer_reviews.text: I needed a slightly larger pack for my MTB...this pack is great..takes a bladder, rain jacket, spare tube and tools and space for a fleece jacket. Has outside zip up pocket plus a dedicated phone pocket on shoulder strap...I love it
customer_reviews.author: Graham Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Great features, aero, enough quality to be worth $$
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly decent quality for the price, and excellent features. If this only lasts a year (which it seems like it easily should) I will definitely feel I’ve gotten my money’s worth, just by how handy it has proven. I own several Camlbaks, but was looking for a cheap alternative (without the water bladder) as a daily beater commute rig and this absolutely checks all the required boxes. Very handy for a aero commute bag that fits a change of clothes, food, and daily necessities. Waist strap takes the pressure off your shoulders and the helmet net is admittedly very useful, making bike commuting long distance into an office environment much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Meow Face

customer_reviews.title: nice fit
customer_reviews.text: use this for day hiking and it is the right size. I hike alot with my dog and carry both our stuff for a day hike no problem and it is comfortable. I added a few D rings to mine to hook item outside of it.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Great Value

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!  $5 product.
customer_reviews.text: This project was a disappointment. I expected the quality to be a little bit better. Fro m the outside view it looks like it has more to it than what is really there. The main compartment is nothing special. Feels like it has a flimsy plastic 2 mm thick support. The utility pouch that comes with it does not fit overall with the pack. I was looking for this to be a mountain biking pack but I wouldn't trust it to hold up and trying it on with a hydration system inside and filled with water was not comfortable at all.
